result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael C. Mull was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
------------------------------

No alcohol at the discretion of Agent. No sex offender registry. No contact with victim.
------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent and follow through.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
------------------------------

timeConds.notes: to commence on or before January 25, 2016 at 8:00 a.m. with work release privileges. Jail time may be served in Walworth County or Pennsylvania.

charges.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

ADDRESS INFO for Michael C. Mull
Current: 593 Jonestown Rd., Jonestown, PA 17038   (Effective: 04-08-2015)
Prior: 593 Jonestown Rd., Johnstown, PA 17038
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH D.J.C. (VICTIM, DOB 10-01-2001) OR I.M.M (WITNESS, DOB 12-13-2001) OR THEIR RESIDENCES.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Michael C. Mull in court with attorney Mick H Sellergren.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Arraignment scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:15 pm.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
